sage.util

Class MathUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.util.MathUtils

  • public class MathUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains a variety of math-oriented utility routines.
    Author:
    John Clevenger

      Converts a spherical coordinate (theta, phi, r) to Cartesian coordinates, where theta = azimuth (rotation around Y) in degrees, phi = altitude (angle above the XZ plane) in degrees, and r = radius (distance from origin to the spherical coordinate point.

    • Method Detail

      • isPowerOfTwo

        public static boolean isPowerOfTwo(int number)
        Returns whether or not the given number is an even power-of-two. Note that this method returns false for given numbers less than or equal to zero.
        Parameters:
        number - the number to check
        Returns:
        true if the given number is an even power of two; false if not.

      • sphericalToCartesian

        public static graphicslib3D.Point3D sphericalToCartesian(graphicslib3D.Point3D sphereCoords)
        Converts a point from Spherical coordinates to Cartesian and returns the result. Assumes a right-handed coordinate system where positive Y represents "up", and that the three components of the specified spherical coordinate (stored in a Point3D object) are azimuth (angle about Y in degrees), altitude (angle above the XZ plane in degrees) and radius (distance from the origin) in that order.
        Parameters:
        sphereCoords - - the input point in spherical coordinates, where the X component represents azimuth, the Y component represents altitude, and the Z component represents radius
        Returns:
        a Point3D containing the corresponding Cartesian coordinate

      • sphericalToCartesian

        public static graphicslib3D.Point3D sphericalToCartesian(double azimuthDegrees,
                                                         double altitudeDegrees,
                                                         double radius)
        Converts a spherical coordinate (theta, phi, r) to Cartesian coordinates, where theta = azimuth (rotation around Y) in degrees, phi = altitude (angle above the XZ plane) in degrees, and r = radius (distance from origin to the spherical coordinate point.

      • cartesianToSpherical

        public static graphicslib3D.Point3D cartesianToSpherical(graphicslib3D.Point3D cartCoords)
        Converts a point from Cartesian coordinates (assuming a right-handed coordinate system with positive Y being up) to Spherical coordinates and returns the result in a Point3D whose components are X=Azimuth, Y=Altitude, and Z=Radius.
        Parameters:
        cartCoords - - a Cartesian coordinate in a right-handed system with Y going "up"
        Returns:
        - a Point3D containing the corresponding spherical coordinate (Azimuth, Altitude, Radius)

      • clamp

        public static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> T clamp(T value,
                                                          T min,
                                                          T max)
        Restricts a value to be within a specified range. Usually used for numeric values.
        Parameters:
        value - - The value to clamp.
        min - - The minimum. If value is less than min then min will be returned.
        max - - The maximum. If value is less than max then max will be returned.
        Returns:
        The clamped value.

      • vector3DToPoint3D

        public static graphicslib3D.Point3D vector3DToPoint3D(graphicslib3D.Vector3D vector)
        Returns a Vector3D as a Point3D.
        Parameters:
        vector - - The vector to return as a point. It is assumed to be a vector from the origin.

      • randomFloat

        public static float randomFloat()
        Returns a random float between 0 and 1. Used explicitly by ColorRGBA
